intro: Tragia fallacina, commonly known as the false tragia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture. Tragia fallacina is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
